alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 2:22PM EDT until July 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Cumberland County in southwestern Maine... Northwestern York County in southwestern Maine... Southwestern Oxford County in western Maine... East Central Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Runoff will cause rises on the Little Ossipee River and nearby tributaries. Interests in this area should stream and river rises. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Conway, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Hiram, Effingham, Cornish, Limington, Limerick, Madison and Acton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Life Threatening flooding is occurring. Take action NOW to move to higher ground! If trapped, do not attempt to cross fast moving water. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
